com.erikartymiuk.badbudgetlogic.main

Class BadBudgetData

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.erikartymiuk.badbudgetlogic.main.BadBudgetData

  • public class BadBudgetData
extends java.lang.Object
    Class representing a users data. All accounts (including savings accounts), all MoneyOwed debts, all MoneyGains.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructor and Description

      BadBudgetData constructor.

    • Constructor Detail

      • BadBudgetData

        public BadBudgetData()
        BadBudgetData constructor. Sets up all accounts, debts, and gains as empty. Any accounts, debts, and gains need to be added individually. The budget (and budgetItems) also needs to be added separately.

      • getAccountWithName

        public Account getAccountWithName(java.lang.String name)
        Given an accounts name, this method returns the account object, if it exists, in the data's collection of accounts
        Returns:
        the account with the given name or null if the account isn't part of this bb data.

      • getDebtWithName

        public MoneyOwed getDebtWithName(java.lang.String name)
        Given the name of a debt (money owed object) this method returns the moneyOwed object in this BB data object (if it exists).
        Parameters:
        name - - the name of the debt
        Returns:
        - the MoneyOwed object corresponding to the debt or null if it isn't in this BB data object

      • getGainWithDescription

        public MoneyGain getGainWithDescription(java.lang.String description)
        Given the description of a gain, this method returns the gain object in this BB data object, if present.
        Parameters:
        description - - the description of the gain object to return
        Returns:
        - the gain object or null if not present

      • getLossWithDescription

        public MoneyLoss getLossWithDescription(java.lang.String description)
        Given the description of a loss, this method returns the loss object in this BB data object, if present.
        Parameters:
        description - - the description of the loss to search for
        Returns:
        - the loss in this BB data object or null if it isn't present

      • deleteAccountWithName

        public boolean deleteAccountWithName(java.lang.String name)
        Remove the account with the given name from the collection of accounts. If no such account exists false is returned.
        Parameters:
        name - - the name of the account to delete from our data
        Returns:
        true if the delete succeeded, false if no account with the passed name exists in our data

      • deleteDebtWithName

        public boolean deleteDebtWithName(java.lang.String name)
        Given a debt name, this method deletes the debt from our bad budget data object, if it exists.
        Parameters:
        name - - the name of the debt to delete
        Returns:
        true if the debt exists in our data, false if it does not and couldn't be removed

      • deleteGainWithDescription

        public boolean deleteGainWithDescription(java.lang.String description)
        Given a description of a gain, we attempt to remove that gain from our bad budget data object.
        Parameters:
        description - - the description (treated as a key) of the gain to remove
        Returns:
        - true if this item was removed successfully, false if a gain with this description didn't exist in our data

      • deleteLossWithDescription

        public boolean deleteLossWithDescription(java.lang.String description)
        Given a loss description (treated as a key) of a loss, this method attempts to remove that loss from the bad budget data.
        Parameters:
        description - - the description of the loss to remove
        Returns:
        - true if the loss was successfully found and removed, false if a loss with this description could not be removed.

      • clearPredictData

        public void clearPredictData()
        Clears all the prediction data from all the items in this bad budget data object.

      • getSourceWithName

        public Source getSourceWithName(java.lang.String name)
        Searches for the Source with the given name in this bbd. If found returns that Source. returns null if the name isn't a source in our bbd. Possible sources are Accounts and Credit Cards. If an account and cc exist with the passed name the account is returned as the source.
        Parameters:
        name - - the name of the source to search for
        Returns:
        the Source with the given name

      • getSources

        public java.util.ArrayList<Source> getSources()
        Returns a list of all this bbd's sources (includes all accounts and all credit cards)
        Returns:
        a list of this bbd's sources

      • getSourcesExcludeSavingAccounts

        public java.util.ArrayList<Source> getSourcesExcludeSavingAccounts()
        Gets all of the bbd's object sources but excludes any savings accounts
        Returns:
        a list of this bbd's sources excluding savings accounts

      • getSourceWithNameExcludeSavingAccounts

        public Source getSourceWithNameExcludeSavingAccounts(java.lang.String name)
        Searches for the Source with the given name in this bbd but doesn't consider any savings accounts. If found returns that Source returns null if the name isn't a source in our bbd. Possible sources are Accounts (excluding SavingsAccounts here) and Credit Cards. If an non-savings account and cc exist with the passed name the account is returned as the source.
        Parameters:
        name - - the name of the source to search for
        Returns:
        the Source with the given name
